H0.text: Constant weathering and erosion is the condition necessary for metamorphic rocks to form.

H1.text: Extreme pressure and heating are necessary for metamorphic rocks to form.

H2.text: Rapid burial of sediments is a condition necessary for metamorphic rocks to form.

H3.text: Slow cooling of magma is the condition necessary for metamorphic rocks to form.

A4.text: Rocks exposed to high temperatures and pressures can be changed physically or chemically to form a different rock, called metamorphic.
